intro: Habracanthus leonardianus, commonly known as the Leonard's habracanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
